Listing 14.21: Example of making a prediction with a Ô¨Åt MLP model.
In order to make a prediction beyond the limit of known data, this requires that the last n
known observations are taken as an array and used as input. The predict() function expects
one or more samples of inputs when making a prediction, so providing a single sample requires
the array to have the shape [1, n input], where n input is the number of time steps that the
